default:
HELP             Get information about a command
CLEAR CLR        Clear the console
RESTART          Restarting the server
STOP             Server shutdown
START            Starting up the server
EXIT             Shutting down the server and closing the console
GETIP GIP        Show server IP address
SETIP SIP        Set server IP address
GETPORT GP       Get server port
SETPORT SP       Set server port
GETENDPOINT GEP  Get full server address
SETENDPOINT SEP  Set full server address
help:
Get information about a command

HELP [command]

command - The command about which you want to find out information

Example: HELP CLEAR
clear:
Clear the console
Has no arguments whatsoever
clr:
Clear the console
Has no arguments whatsoever
restart:
Restarting the server
Has no arguments whatsoever
stop:
Server shutdown
Has no arguments whatsoever
start:
Starting up the server
Has no arguments whatsoever
exit:
Shutting down the server and closing the console
Has no arguments whatsoever
getip:
Show current server IP address
Has no arguments whatsoever
setip:
Set a different server IP address

SETIP [IP]

IP - Server IP address. Format:***.***.***.***

Example: SETIP 127.0.0.1
gip:
Show current server IP address
Has no arguments whatsoever
sip:
Set a different server IP address

SIP [IP]

IP - Server IP address. Format:***.***.***.***

Example: SIP 127.0.0.1
getport:
Show current server port
Has no arguments whatsoever
setport:
Set a different server port

SETPORT [port]

port - Server port. Format: number in range 49152—65535

Example: SETPORT 50000
gp:
Show current server port
Has no arguments whatsoever
sp:
Set a different server port

SP [port]

port - Server port. Format: number in range 49152—65535

Example: SP 50000
getendpoint:
Show current server full address
Has no arguments whatsoever
setendpoint:
Set a different full server address

SETENDPOINT [fulladdress]
 ulladdress - Server port. Format: ***.***.***.***:*****, port in range 49152—65535

Example: SETENDPOINT 127.0.0.1:50000
gep:
Show current server full address
Has no arguments whatsoever
sep:
Set a different full server address

SEP [fulladdress]
 ulladdress - Server port. Format: ***.***.***.***:*****, port in range 49152—65535

Example: SEP 127.0.0.1:50000
